channel.title: Using iPod as external hard drive?
channel.description:
I just got an 80 GB Video iPod for Christmas, and I plugged it in and copied music etc. and whatever.
Later I was installing some programs on my computer, and I had to go to My Computer to apply a crack for a program. Well, along with my C:, D:, and my virtual CD drives, I saw a G: drive, which was named zPod (z for Zach). I went into it and it acted like any other external hard drive.
So, basically what I'm asking, is it safe to copy any files to it (programs etc.) and use it to backup things if I need to reformat my computer or something? If so, then it has just saved me a few bucks, because I was planning on buying a 60 GB external hard drive.
And another thing, does the iPod itself have an actual hard drive, or just a flash drive? I noticed when I copy songs to it, it makes those clicking sounds just like the hard drive in your computer does (except quieter).
